fastidious.definition: Very attentive to and concerned about accuracy and detail
examples: Denton was fastidious about his appearance and he expected the woman at his side to mirror that image
He is very fastidious about how a suitcase should be packed
This is going to sound completely fatuous, but it's my honest answer
Behind its fatuous claims of 'managed migration', the Government is starting to worry

fiasco.definition: A complete failure, especially a ludicrous or humiliating one
examples: Annie might have a fiasco on her hands if she doesn't act quickly
Steve was not a good organizer so Tina's surprise party turned out to be a complete fiasco

finesse.definition: Elegant or delicate skill, tact;the ability to handle delicate situations diplomatically
examples: She handled the interview questions with finesse
He maneuvered his opponent into checkmate with his customary finesse

flaunt.definition: Display (something) ostentatiously, especially in order to provoke envy or admiration or to show defiance
examples: She liked to flaunt her wealth by wearing furs and jewelry
He's flaunted the divine codes for too long
